acdc.Core.Utils

Class Hash

  • java.lang.Object
    • acdc.Core.Utils.Hash

  • public class Hash
extends java.lang.Object
    Hash is a class with 2 different way of hashing with the MD5 algorithm.

    • sampleHashFile

      This hash has a constant complexity. It takes samples at the beginning, in the middle and at the end and hash it. It's quick but can output some errors.

    • md5ofFile

      This hash complexity depends on the file size. It hashes all the file. It's very slow but can't output errors.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Baptiste

      • sampleHashFile

        public static java.lang.String sampleHashFile(java.lang.String path)
                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                              java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Hashing only three samples of the file
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file to hash.
        Returns:
        the hash of the file as a string.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the file is protected for example
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - when the algo is not available in the environnment

        Parameters:
        file - the path of the file to hash.
        Returns:
        the hash of the file as a string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when the algo is not available in the environment.
